messages.message: I have an issue in a test environment I’ve spun up, where the top “action” bar is covered by a white haze, like there is a drop-down covering it. This is happening in Chrome and Firefox.It (http://Firefox.It) prevents me from clicking on anything (like “Run program”, to use an example at random). Any idea what the heck's going on?

I can’t scroll “up” to make it go away, I’ve tried clicking everywhere to no avail, tabbing doesn’t change the input to ‘run’ to let me hit enter. If anyone wants to see for themselves, the instance is at https://dbishoptestazure.instabase.com, login <mailto:dbishop@instabase.com|dbishop@instabase.com>:changeme123
This is using `apps-server:19.07.17-09acaf4`, which I believe is what we’re using in prod, though I should probably double-check that.
Looks like there's some html css not up to date in this environment - that's a remnant from the old top toolbar. The Web service is the one that would affect that
Ok, I’ll grab a newer version/check to see how I screwed that up. Thanks! :slightly_smiling_face:

It looks like the source of the problem was actually an older version of `apps-server`. Updated that to match my current version of nginx and webapps, and it stopped trying to load the `ibcoreui_navbar` JS file, which apparently is not a thing anymore. Thanks for your help, Jessica!
Oh glad you figured it out, sorry I steered you in the wrong direction!
No worries, it nudged me closer to the source :slightly_smiling_face:
